name: Palm Springs Visitor Center (Tramway Gas Station)
address: 2901 N Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: Begin at the Palm Springs Visitor Center, formerly the Tramway Gas Station. This iconic building with its distinctive soaring roof was designed by Albert Frey and Robson Chambers.

name: Steel Development Houses
address: 290 E Simms Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: The Steel Development Houses showcase innovative prefabricated steel construction methods pioneered by Donald Wexler.

name: Kaufmann Desert House
address: 470 W Vista Chino, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: One of the most important examples of International Style architecture in the Americas.

name: Elvis Honeymoon Hideaway (Alexander Estate)
description: Also known as the House of Tomorrow, where Elvis and Priscilla Presley spent their honeymoon.

name: Frey House II
description: Albert Frey's personal residence, ingeniously integrated into the hillside.

name: Palm Springs Art Museum
description: A prime example of desert modernism by E. Stewart Williams.

name: Bank of America Building
address: 588 S Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92264
description: One of the finest examples of mid-century modern bank design.

name: Palm Springs City Hall
address: 3200 E Tahquitz Canyon Way, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: Features Frey's distinctive design elements including the iconic brise-soleil.

name: Racquet Club Estates
address: 2743 N Starr Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: A neighborhood of Alexander Construction Company homes featuring butterfly roofs and innovative desert modern design.

name: Del Marcos Hotel
address: 225 W Baristo Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: One of William F. Cody's earliest and most significant works in Palm Springs.
